name: Capital Ring (section 04) - alternative for dogs in Norwood Grove

ai.summary: A brief, dog-friendly segment of the Capital Ring (Section 04) through Norwood Grove. At about 0.2 km, it offers an easy, flat route suitable for all ages and well-behaved dogs seeking a quick, scenic stroll near the city.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat, well-maintained paths along mixed gravel and grass. Some shaded woodland and open clearings; expect occasional roots and damp patches after rain. Very short distance means little elevation change.
ai.safety_notes: Keep dogs on a short leash where required and under voice control. Be mindful of other walkers and cyclists on shared paths. Check local signage for leash rules in Norwood Grove. Carry water and poop bags; footwear should provide good traction, as surfaces can be slippery when wet.
recommended_gear: Water for you and your dog
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for the most comfortable conditions; year-round visits are possible, though rain can make surfaces muddy and the shade may be limited in winter.
